mdRecord.dcterms:description: Reed Hall (1877), stone panel at corner

The Episcopal Divinity School (EDS) was founded in 1974 by combining the Episcopal Theological School (ETS) and the Philadelphia Divinity School (PDS). In 2016, the school's board of trustees decided that the school would cease granting degrees after the end of the 2016–2017 academic year. After several months of evaluating how it could continue to support the school's mission of theological education, the board of trustees decided to affiliate EDS with Union Theological Seminary in New York City and sell its Cambridge campus. In 2018, Lesley purchased the rest of EDS's former Cambridge campus. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Episcopal_Divinity_School [work]
